faq.title: What is Staking? Why should I stake?
faq.text: Staking is the process of delegating, or locking up, cryptocurrency tokens to a validator. In return for locking up tokens, delegators receive staking rewards from the network.

faq.title: Are my tokens safe when I delegate to a validator?
faq.text: Yes! Staking is a non-custodial service, which means the validator never has access to your funds or rewards.

faq.title: What is slashing, and does Vault Staking offer any protection from it?
faq.text: Slashing is a penalty to a validator and its delegators when the validator misbehaves. Soft slashing is when a validator has continuous downtime, and is usually less than a 1% penalty. Hard slashing is when a validator double signs a block, and is usually between a 5% and 10% penalty. Vault Staking offers both soft and hard slashing refunds if our delegators lose funds due to a slashing penalty.
